name: Refuge Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friends have been coming here for years, and persuaded us to join them on an unseasonably warm weekend in January. The family-run inn is right by the bridge to Assateague Island Nat'l Seashore. It doesn't look fancy from the outside--a little weather beaten, but remember, it is at the ocean. Attractive enough and VERY clean inside.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean, and by the park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each room is decorated and furnished differently (we peeked in a bunch of them). Rooms have a coffee maker, hair dryer, small refrigerator and each has a patio or balcony. The side facing the parking lot also faces ponies in the inn's paddock. The Continental breakfast bar is fine, tho basic. One hot dish a day is also offered (French toast that morning) and is made to order. There is a large indoor swimming pool and a hot tub.
reviews.title: Pleasant local place, very close to the park

reviews.text: They offer a 20% off, nonrefundable Gotta Get Away deal (but not on holidays) that can only be booked by phone within 48 hours of check-in. The normal AAA rate is 10% off.
reviews.title: Best on the island, in ways that matter

reviews.text: We visited during the off season, and the motel I had chosen was closed without notice, and an alternate choice was for sale. My wife thought this place looked nice, and best of all, open. Our off-season rate with AAA discount was $80. At that price, it was more expensive than some of the older motels on the island, but much nicer. I was pleased to give my money to a local family, rather than a franchise, which most of the fancier places are.
reviews.title: Great local place with excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is sort of quirky, a long wooden thing which looks like it's from the '70s. The rooms have been nicely updated (the room next to ours was actually being repainted). We asked for a second floor room, and got a view into a little pine forest behind the motel. The room was quite large, and had a fridge (a microwave was out on the landing near the coke machines). The TV was older, and not terribly large, but the cabinet for it had a full-length mirror, which was a clever touch. The bed was comfortable, with clean sheets, fluffy pillows, and a blanket for the chilly nights. The HVAC unit heated the room well, but was rather noisy.
reviews.title: I would recommend this hotel because of its proximity to Assateague.

reviews.text: We have been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. I have seen the same people year after year and look forward to seeing them on our vacation. You can't go wrong here. There are always Chincoteague ponies right next to the parking lot, great bikes for rent right on the property and they have a hot tub, heated pool, sauna and exercise room that my wife and I always enjoy when we come. Best of all it is an updated hotel that preserves the character of he island.
reviews.title: A consistently great stay year after year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Real nice hotel, clean and very quiet! We stayed here 2 nights.
reviews.title: Close to Chincoteague Island

reviews.text: We asked for a room with view on the pines and were in the middle of the pine trees.
reviews.title: A little bit of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not need the AC because it was cool in the evenings and they have ( thank God) fly screens in front of the windows and french doors which we opened. Beds are comfortable.
reviews.title: 20+years of joy

reviews.text: Next day we rented a bike from the bike stall adjacent to the hotel( 18 Dollars for a whole day) and went to explore Chincoteague Island which was 5 minutes on the bike away from the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect locally owned family motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very pleasant stay in September--the Inn was sold out even though it was the beginning of the off season. Not a fancy resort but was perfectly clean, comfortable and nice for the price. We booked our room within 48 hours and got 20% off which was awesome (check your bill-discount wasn't originally on there). Not on the water but the location is still great, right outside of the entrance to Asseteague with plenty of nearby dining. Room had a comfortable King bed, minifridge, coffee machine, patio, flatscreen TV and DVD player (bring some movies--no nightlife in Chincoteague--or rent from Steve's down the street). Pool, hot tub, ponies, and bike rentals onsite. Breakfast was ok--oatmeal, cereals, breads and french toast. Staff was friendly.
reviews.title: Comfortable family run Inn

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Refuge Inn with my grown children. When I made the reservations I didn't request adjoining rooms but was pleased to find ours were. We were able to move between rooms easily and still had privacy. It was unseasonably cold and rained the entire trip. (Certainly not the fault of the management!). Luckily the rooms were big enough that 5 adults could move about and play board game, laugh, talk and make the best of our time there.
reviews.title: Rainy days.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ponies were adorable and the continental breakfast was adequate. If we wanted a more substantial meal there were plenty of nearby options. We will return to Chincoteaque and will certainly keep The Refuge Inn in mind!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: This is the only place I have stayed on Chincoteague and it is the only place I will ever stay. We were here for our honeymoon September 11-17 2011 and had an amazing stay. The King deluxe room was beautiful and the staff is simply wonderful. It feels like coming home when you stay here. Make sure to take advantage of the breakfast and the bike depot as well. Everyone here is extremely friendly and ready to answer any questions you may have. We can't wait to go back again this summer!
reviews.title: Loved it, will only stay here while on the island!

reviews.text: Excellent customer service and the whole place is like a small community. It's quiet, in a great location and everyone is super friendly. The rooms have a cute sweet charm but with modern necessities.
reviews.title: Our first trip to Chincoteague and we loved it!

reviews.text: We stayed at the refuge inn on our way home from north Carolina. This was our third visit to chincoteague. We loved our room,207, a king room on the second floor facing the ponies. From our balcony we could see the lighthouse flashing at night. Our room was clean, the staff was amazing, and the bed more comfortable than our own. We loved the easy access to the refuge and to our favorite chincoteague restaurant, the seashell cafe, across the street.
reviews.title: Beautiful inn, lovely room, great staff

reviews.text: The only thing missing was a little personal sized microwave to heat up coffee or make some popcorn. We would also like to suggest that the tv's be hung on the wall to allow more space on the dresser. Flat areas to lay things down were scant. Other than those minor things, everything was perfect. Loved the home made waffles.
reviews.title: Clean, Friendly Staff, Quiet Nights

reviews.text: This was our first trip to Chincoteague. We researched LOTS of places to stay and chose The Refuge Inn for it's great rating. We were pleased with the friendly, helpful staff and the wonderful family atmosphere. It was a welcome change from what chain hotels offer these days. Our room was not very spacious but it was clean and nothing was broken or neglected. The bathroom decor was a bit dated but the shower was hot with great water pressure! The bed was not comfortable for my taste but that's a me problem. Not one time in our three-night stay did we get awakened by loud voices, doors slamming, etc. The breakfast offerings were very basic but DIFFERENT every morning. That was nice. We were less than half a mile from the entrance to Assateague National Seashore. Shops, restaurants were all close-by. There was a bicycle rental on the premises which we took advantage of one day. Weather was too cool for the pool but we looked it over and it seemed like your typical pool. I cannot say enough about the cleaning staff. They bent over backwards to make sure we had what we needed. We were on the first floor and our room, being at ground level, had a dehumidifier in the corner that ran constantly. There was a sign on it saying not to mess with it, so we didn't. I assume all other ground floor rooms had one as well as this is an older hotel. There were no musty or stale odors in our room and it actually provided a nice hum to go to sleep by so we adjusted to it fairly quickly.
reviews.title: Clean basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a nutshell, The Refuge Inn was a basic, family-owned hotel that was clean and fairly priced. We will DEFINITELY make a return trip.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.text: Welcoming, clean, basic motel. Room was small with a small old TV, room service cleaned the room daily. The room had a balcony overlooking the pine side which was nice and quiet. Breakfast was disappointing to me as I was expecting more. Very basic breakfast consisting of milk, cereal, muffins etc. on a plastic plate, plastic cups. They had french toast made to order where they gave one slice of white bread on a plastic plate. No home baked goods or fresh fruit salad. We were there in August labour day weekend and there were not enough tables/chairs to accommodate guests inside or outside. The pool area was nice, however, if you have children don't go at night when there are groups of adults there because they can be drunk and use profanity in the presence of young kids. The gift shop was nice. Overall OK very basic motel.
reviews.title: Just right

description: Exceed your expectations in this family owned inn where no detail is overlooked. The Refuge Inn is located within walking distance of the wildlife refuge and minutes from our beautiful undeveloped beach. Amenities include Continental Breakfast, Wireless Internet, Indoor/Outdoor Heated Pool, Hot Tub, Fitness Room, Bicycle & Beach Gear Rentals, Conference Room and Gift Shop. A Treasure of a place, Family Owned and Proudly Operated.
